## Step 1: Write a system of 124 equations
\begin{align*}
4^{x_1}&=5\\
5^{x_2}&=6\\
6^{x_3}&=7\\
&\vdots\\
127^{x_{124}}&=128
\end{align*}

## Step 2: Take the logarithm base 2 of both sides of each equation
\begin{align*}
\log_2 4^{x_1}&=\log_2 5\\
\log_2 5^{x_2}&=\log_2 6\\
\log_2 6^{x_3}&=\log_2 7\\
&\vdots\\
\log_2 127^{x_{124}}&=\log_2 128
\end{align*}

## Step 3: Simplify the left-hand side of each equation using logarithmic identity
\begin{align*}
x_1\log_2 4&=\log_2 5\\
x_2\log_2 5&=\log_2 6\\
x_3\log
## Step 4: Use the definition of logarithm to rewrite the equation as an exponential equation
\begin{align*}
2^{2x_1}&=5\\
2^{2x_2}&=6\\
2^{2x_3}&=7\\
&\vdots\\
2^{2x_{124}}&=128
\end{align*}
## Step 5: We can rewrite the system of equations as
\begin{align*}
2^{2x_1}&=5\\
2^{2x_2}&=6\\
2^{2x_3}&=7\\
&\vdots\\
2^{2x_{124}}&=2^7
\end{align*}
## Step 6
2^{2x_1} = 5\\
2^{2x_2}=6\\
2^{2x_3}=7\\
&\vdots\\
2^{2x_{124}}=2^7\\
## Step 7
2^{2x_1} = 5 = 2^{\log_2 5}\\
2^{2x_2}=6 = 2^{\log_2 6}\\
2^{2x_3}=7 = 2^{\log_2 7}\\
&\vdots\\
2^{2x_{124}}=2^7 = 2^{\log_2 2^7}
## Step 8
2x_1 = \log_2 5\\
2x_2 = \log_2 6\\
2x_3 = \log_2 7\\
&\vdots\\
2x_{124} = \log_2 2^7
## Step 9
x_1 = \frac{1}{2} \log_2 5\\
x_2 = \frac{1
## Step 10
x_1x_2\cdots x_{124} = \frac{1}{2} \log_2 5 \cdot \frac{1}{2} \log_2 6 \cdots \frac{1}{2} \log_2 2^7 = \frac{1}{2} \log_2 (5 \cdot 6 \cdots 2^7)
## Step 11
x_1x_2\cdots x_{124} = \frac{1}{2} \log_2 (5 \cdot 6 \cdots 2^7) = \frac{1}{2} \log_2 \frac{2^7!}{2^0!}
= \frac{1}{2} \log_2 \frac{2^7!}{1}
= \frac{1}{2} \log_2 (2^7 \cdot 6 \cdot 7 \cdot 8 \cdot 9 \cdots 126)
= \frac{1}{2} (\log_2 2^7 + \log_2 6 + \log_2 7 + \log_2 8 + \cdots + \log_2 126)
= \frac{1}{2} (7 + \log_2 6 + \log_2 7 + \log_2 8 + \cdots + \log_2 126)
= \frac{1}{2} (7 + \log_2 (2^3 \cdot 3 \cdot 7) +
## Step 12
= \frac{1}{2} (7 + 3 + \log_2 3 + 1 + \log_2 7 + \log_2 8 + \cdots + \log_2 126)
= \frac{1}{2} (11 + \log_2 3 + \log_2 7 + \log_2 8 + \cdots + \log_2 126)

The final answer is: $\boxed{0}$
